text: Gaunspur is a village in Kapurthala district of Punjab State, India. It is located from Kapurthala, which is both district and sub-district headquarters of Gaunspur. The village is administrated by a Sarpanch, who is an elected representative. == Demography == According to the report published by Census India in 2011, Gaunspur has a total number of 8 houses and population of 43 of which include 14 males and 29 females. Literacy rate of Gaunspur is 86.49%, higher than state average of 75.84%. The population of children under the age of 6 years is 6 which is 13.95% of total population of Gaunspur, and child sex ratio is approximately 5000, higher than state average of 846. == Population data == {|class="wikitable sortable" !
